trans-unit.source: How to Manage Federation Certificates in Azure AD | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: How to Manage Federation Certificates in Azure AD | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to customize the expiration date for your federation certificates, and how to renew certificates that will soon expire.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to customize the expiration date for your federation certificates, and how to renew certificates that will soon expire.

trans-unit.source: Managing Certificates for Federated Single Sign-On in Azure Active Directory
trans-unit.target: Managing Certificates for Federated Single Sign-On in Azure Active Directory

trans-unit.source: This article covers common questions related to the certificates that Azure Active Directory creates in order to establish federated single sign-on (SSO) to your SaaS applications.
trans-unit.target: This article covers common questions related to the certificates that Azure Active Directory creates in order to establish federated single sign-on (SSO) to your SaaS applications.

trans-unit.source: This article is only relevant to apps that are configured to use **Azure AD Single Sign-On**, as shown in the example below:
trans-unit.target: This article is only relevant to apps that are configured to use **Azure AD Single Sign-On**, as shown in the example below:

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: How to Customize the Expiration Date for your Federation Certificate
trans-unit.target: How to Customize the Expiration Date for your Federation Certificate

trans-unit.source: By default, certificates are set to expire after two years.
trans-unit.target: By default, certificates are set to expire after two years.

trans-unit.source: You can choose a different expiration date for your certificate by following the steps below.
trans-unit.target: You can choose a different expiration date for your certificate by following the steps below.

trans-unit.source: The included screenshots use ServiceNow for the sake of example, but these steps can apply to any federated SaaS app.
trans-unit.target: The included screenshots use ServiceNow for the sake of example, but these steps can apply to any federated SaaS app.

trans-unit.source: In Azure Active Directory, on the Quick Start page for your application, click on **Configure single sign-on**.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Active Directory, on the Quick Start page for your application, click on **Configure single sign-on**.

trans-unit.source: Open the SSO configuration wizard.
trans-unit.target: Open the SSO configuration wizard.

trans-unit.source: Select **Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Azure AD Single Sign-On**, and then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Type in the **Sign-On URL** of your application, and select the checkbox for **Configure the certificate used for federated single sign-on**.
trans-unit.target: Type in the **Sign-On URL** of your application, and select the checkbox for **Configure the certificate used for federated single sign-on**.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: On the next page, select **Generate a new certificate**, and select how long you'd like the certificate to be valid for.
trans-unit.target: On the next page, select **Generate a new certificate**, and select how long you'd like the certificate to be valid for.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Generate a new certificate
trans-unit.target: Generate a new certificate

trans-unit.source: Next, click on **Download certificate**.
trans-unit.target: Next, click on **Download certificate**.

trans-unit.source: To learn how to upload the certificate to your particular SaaS app, click **View configuration instructions**.
trans-unit.target: To learn how to upload the certificate to your particular SaaS app, click **View configuration instructions**.

trans-unit.source: Download then upload the certificate
trans-unit.target: Download then upload the certificate

trans-unit.source: The certificate won't be enabled until you select the confirmation checkbox at the bottom of the dialog and then press submit.
trans-unit.target: The certificate won't be enabled until you select the confirmation checkbox at the bottom of the dialog and then press submit.

trans-unit.source: How to Renew a Certificate that will Soon Expire
trans-unit.target: How to Renew a Certificate that will Soon Expire

trans-unit.source: The renewal steps shown below should ideally result in no significant downtime for your users.
trans-unit.target: The renewal steps shown below should ideally result in no significant downtime for your users.

trans-unit.source: The screenshots used in this section feature Salesforce as an example, but these steps can apply to any federated SaaS app.
trans-unit.target: The screenshots used in this section feature Salesforce as an example, but these steps can apply to any federated SaaS app.

trans-unit.source: In Azure Active Directory, on the Quick Start page for your application, click on **Configure Single Sign-On**.
trans-unit.target: In Azure Active Directory, on the Quick Start page for your application, click on **Configure Single Sign-On**.

trans-unit.source: Open the SSO configuration wizard
trans-unit.target: Open the SSO configuration wizard

trans-unit.source: On the first page of the dialog, **Azure AD Single Sign-On** should already be selected, so click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: On the first page of the dialog, **Azure AD Single Sign-On** should already be selected, so click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: On the second page, select the checkbox for **Configure the certificate used for federated single sign-on**.
trans-unit.target: On the second page, select the checkbox for **Configure the certificate used for federated single sign-on**.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Azure AD Single Sign-On
trans-unit.target: Azure AD Single Sign-On

trans-unit.source: On the next page, select **Generate a new certificate**, and select how long you'd like the new certificate to be valid for.
trans-unit.target: On the next page, select **Generate a new certificate**, and select how long you'd like the new certificate to be valid for.

trans-unit.source: Then click **Next**.
trans-unit.target: Then click **Next**.

trans-unit.source: Generate a new certificate
trans-unit.target: Generate a new certificate

trans-unit.source: Click on **Download certificate**.
trans-unit.target: Click on **Download certificate**.

trans-unit.source: To successfully rewnew your certificate, you must perform the following two steps:
trans-unit.target: To successfully rewnew your certificate, you must perform the following two steps:

trans-unit.source: Upload the new certificate to the SaaS app's single sign-on configuration screen.
trans-unit.target: Upload the new certificate to the SaaS app's single sign-on configuration screen.

trans-unit.source: To learn how to do this for your particular SaaS app, click **View configuration instructions**.
trans-unit.target: To learn how to do this for your particular SaaS app, click **View configuration instructions**.

trans-unit.source: In Azure AD, Select the confirmation checkbox at the bottom of the dialog to enable the new certificate, and then click **Next** to submit.
trans-unit.target: In Azure AD, Select the confirmation checkbox at the bottom of the dialog to enable the new certificate, and then click **Next** to submit.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Single sign-on to the app will be disabled the moment either one of these two steps is completed, but it will be enabled again once the second step is completed.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Single sign-on to the app will be disabled the moment either one of these two steps is completed, but it will be enabled again once the second step is completed.

trans-unit.source: Therefore, to minimize downtime, please prepare to accomplish both steps within a short amount of time from each other.
trans-unit.target: Therefore, to minimize downtime, please prepare to accomplish both steps within a short amount of time from each other.

trans-unit.source: Download then upload the certificate
trans-unit.target: Download then upload the certificate

trans-unit.source: See Also
trans-unit.target: See Also

trans-unit.source: Application Access and Single Sign-On in Azure AD
trans-unit.target: Application Access and Single Sign-On in Azure AD

trans-unit.target: test
